paper.title: On Using RSA with Low Exponent in a Public Key Network
paper.abstract: We consider the problem of solving systems of equations Pi(x) ? 0 (mod ni) i = 1... k where Pi are polynomials of degree d and the ni are distinct relatively prime numbers and x d(d+1)/2 we can recover x in polynomial time provided ni ? 2k. This shows that RSA with low exponent is not a good alternative to use as a public key cryptosystem in a large network. It also shows that a protocol by Broder and Dolev [4] is insecure if RSA with low exponent is used.
